It is part of MoS\u2019s larger work in providing evidence and pushing for reforms in policies and procedures related to housing. This map is the result of various exchanges within our networks, and we are particularly grateful for the support of the contributors (see below) and the visual intelligence team.
`,(0,e.jsx)(i.a,{href:"https://cmmm.eu/",children:"CMMM \u2013 Critical Mapping in Municipalist Movements"})," is a 3.5-year research project that brings together an international team from Barcelona, Berlin, and Belgrade. It is hosted at ",(0,e.jsx)(i.a,{href:"https://labor-k.org/",children:"K LA"}),", ",(0,e.jsx)(i.a,{href:"https://www.tu.berlin/en/",children:"TU Berlin"}),", supported by the ",(0,e.jsx)(i.a,{href:"https://www.bosch-stiftung.de/de",children:"Robert Bosch Stiftung"}),", and implemented in collaboration with ",(0,e.jsx)(i.a,{href:"https://observatoridesc.org/en/who-we-are",children:"Observatori DESC"})," (BCN), ",(0,e.jsx)(i.a,{href:"https://aks.gemeinwohl.berlin/",children:"AKS Gemeinwohl"})," (BLN), ",(0,e.jsx)(i.a,{href:"https://raumstation.org/",children:"Kollektiv Raumstation"})," (BLN), and ",(0,e.jsx)(i.a,{href:"https://ministarstvoprostora.org/",children:"Ministarstvo Prostora"})," (Ministry of Space) (BGD). In parallel to this Belgrade-based map, the Barcelona Team developed their \u201CStop Evictions!\u201D [KDF4] map, and the Berlin Team produced their ",(0,e.jsx)(i.a,{href:"https://cmmm-maps.eu/berlin/",children:"\u201CCommoning Berlin\u201D"})," map."]}),(0,e.jsx)(i.h2,{children:"PROTOTYPE CONCEPT"}),(0,e.jsx)(i.p,{children:`Even though housing is a basic right, it has become unaffordable for approx. 80% of the inhabitants of Serbia because apartments are now commodities that can be exchanged on the market for profit. This high degree of housing unaffordability produces overcrowded and inadequate living situations and increases the risk of indebtedness. It engenders spatial inequalities and segregation in our cities.
Our map clearly shows the scope of housing unaffordability in Belgrade, as well as its socially segregationist spatial consequences. By exploring our own situation and that of our neighbors and friends, we can see to what extent apartments are generally available on the market and in which parts of the city we can or cannot afford to live. Understanding this problem, which many of us share, is the first step toward changing the situation systematically, through wider mobilization to make housing unaffordability a higher priority on the political agenda.
The design of this map is the result of various exchanges within our local networks, including the findings from the three workshops: \u201CThe Housing [Utility Service] Burdens of Social Housing Tenants\u201D (Nov \u201820), \u201CHow to Obtain Publicly-Owned Land for the Purpose of Non-Profit Housing?\u201D (Dec \u201820), and \u201CCritical Mapping of the Unaffordability of Housing in Belgrade\u201D (April \u201921), which featured guests from various backgrounds.[1]`}),(0,e.jsx)(i.p,{children:"To map affordable housing offers for the specific scenarios, we use TWO VARIABLES: the size of the household (number of members), and the self-assessed monthly household income. The algorithm behind this map relies on international and domestic standards in calculating the number of units on offer that are considered adequate in terms of size and price per scenario, as well as their locations. The results shown for both renting and buying are filtered as follows:"}),(0,e.jsxs)(i.ol,{children:[`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(i.li,{children:[(0,e.jsx)(i.strong,{children:"Spatial suitability:"}),' According to the "adequate apartment" standard, which is defined by the Law on Housing and Building Maintenance (Article 90), the relation between the number of residents and the minimum total area of an apartment is as follows:']}),`
`]}),(0,e.jsxs)(i.ul,{children:[`

`,(0,e.jsxs)(i.li,{children:[(0,e.jsx)(i.strong,{children:"Affordability:"})," The internationally adopted upper limit for the housing burden is 40% of the monthly household income. This value includes costs other than rent or mortgage payments, such as utilities and heating.[2] Therefore, the algorithm here sets a threshold of 30%. This means, in the case of renting, the displayed affordable offers are those where the monthly rent is equal to or less than one third of the household\u2019s indicated monthly income. Additionally, in the case of purchasing, it is assumed that one can meet the following conditions:"]}),`

Osim \u0161to ovako veliki stepen nepriu\u0161tivosti stanova proizvodi situacije \u017Eivota u prenaseljenim stanovima ili prostorima neadekvatnim za stanovanje, kao i rizika od prezadu\u017Eenosti zbog stambenih tro\u0161kova, on podsti\u010De razvoj prostorne nejednakosti ili segregacije."]}),(0,o.jsxs)(i.p,{children:[(0,o.jsx)(i.strong,{children:"Ovaj sajt predstavlja"})," jedan mogu\u0107i na\u010Din na koji se brzo i jasno mo\u017Ee uo\u010Diti i obim problema nepriu\u0161tivosti stanovanja, ali i njegove prostorne posledice. Kroz istra\u017Eivanje na\u0161ih sopstvenih situacija, ali i situacija na\u0161ih kom\u0161ija ili prijatelja, vide\u0107emo u kojoj meri su nam uop\u0161te dostupni stanovi na tr\u017Ei\u0161tu, ali i u kojim delovima grada (ne)mo\u017Eemo da priu\u0161timo \u017Eivot. To je po\u010Detni korak u razumevanju problema koji svi delimo i koji tek kroz \u0161iru mobilizaciju mo\u017Eemo sistemski i da menjamo."]}),(0,o.jsx)(i.h2,{children:"Metodologija"}),(0,o.jsxs)(i.p,{children:[(0,o.jsx)(i.strong,{children:"U mapiranju priu\u0161tivih stanova"})," za specifi\u010Dne situacije u kojima se svi nalazimo, koristili smo dva unosa:"]}),(0,o.jsxs)(i.ul,{children:[`

`,(0,o.jsx)(i.li,{children:"Drugi kriterijum odnosni se na priu\u0161tivost, koja se oslanja na definiciju gornje granice optere\u0107nosti stambenim tro\u0161kovima u EU koja iznosi maksimalno 40% od mese\u010Dnih prihoda doma\u0107instva.* U algoritmu je uzet prag od 30%, s obzirom da se u onih 40% ubrajaju i stambeni tro\u0161kovi van rente i rate za kredit - komunalije i grejanje. Dakle, u slu\u010Daju najma, odabir \u201Cpriu\u0161tivih\u201D podrazumeva sve stanove koji su prostorno odgovaraju\u0107i, a \u010Diji je mese\u010Dni zakup jednak ili manji od tre\u0107ine unetog mese\u010Dnog prihoda doma\u0107instva. U slu\u010Daju mogu\u0107nosti kupovine, algoritam \u0107e kao rezultat ponuditi sve stanove koji su prostorno odgovaraju\u0107i, a koje mo\u017Eete kupiti na kredit pod slede\u0107im uslovima:"}),`
`]}),(0,o.jsxs)(i.ul,{children:[`

S obzirom na slo\u017Een proces skidanja podataka koji ina\u010De nisu distupni javnosti kao baze, nije mogu\u0107e koristiti podatke u real-time re\u017Eimu.
